c74object.name: bach.abs
c74object.description: Takes the absolute value of an incoming llll.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs and outputs the calculation on the most recently received input llll.

method.name: llll
method.description: For each number of the incoming llll is taken the absolute (non-negative) value, and the llll containing the absolute values (having the same shape as the original one) is output through the outlet. Non-numbers are kept as they are.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: The abstraction is equivalent to the abs function called in a bach.expr object.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The abstraction is equivalent to the abs function called in a bach.expr object.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: absolute value, modulo, magnitude, radius, calculate, compute, sign.
